projects.title: Dailybreak.com
projects.content:
Role: Front End Developer • UX/UI Designer

Dailybreak is a content platform filled with listcles, quizzes, and games that aim to get users to procrastinate with purpose. The site gamifies content engagement by rewarding points that can be used to enter sweepstakes or purchase rewards.

Check it out here.

See a more in-depth case on my archive.

projects.title: Dead Drop </br>Desperado
projects.content:
Role: Producer • Sound Designer • Gameplay Engineer • Voice Actor

A mobile spaghetti western showdown where players rely only on sound to dodge bullets. Using Bose's new AR technology we aimed to create an intuitive experience that gets players back's bending like Neo from the Matrix to dodge bullets shot by another player holding their phone.

See a more in-depth case on my archive.

projects.title: Becker Derby
projects.content:
Role: Project Lead • Developer • Publisher • Designer

Becker Derby is the 3rd installment in my Starlot Derby series of rouge-like homerun derbys. Featuring Becker College's very own Hank the Hawk, Becker Derby has players charging up powerful homeruns that bounce off seagulls and rip open the fabric of spacetime. An augmeneted reality game was also played on Becker's main campus to connect students together to discover the expanded universe of Starlot Derby.

Check it out here (iOS) or here (Android).

See a more in-depth case on my archive.

projects.title: Hibachi Hero
projects.content:
Role: Lead Designer • Tools Developer

A one touch food shooter to go, Hibachi Hero is the brainchild of an internship team going against the grain. Developed during Mass DiGI's Summer Internship program in 2015, we aimed to create a simple yet effective experience over the course of 3 months. Little did we know, we gained the attention of a publisher (Thumbspire) and the Boston Children's Hospital Neuromotion Labs. Hibachi Hero has gone on to become a highly utilized tool to assist emotional co-regulation in children who struggle to identify their feelings.

Check it out here (iOS) or here (Android) or here (Mightier).

See a more in-depth case on my archive.

projects.title: Lotto' Boxes
projects.content:
Role: UX Designer

Lotto' Boxes is an educational mobile app that teaches kids about income inequality. Players aim to pay their rent on time and work towards the possiblity of a better life. It was made for the Silicon Valley Community Foundation and launched at their annual foundation event in San Francisco.

Check it out here.

See a more in-depth case on my archive.

projects.title: Much Much More</br>...
projects.content:
I've worked on a lot more stuff!

Some finished, some not, but if you wanted to delve deeper I've got an entire archive of experiments and projects here.
